Pre-Game Insights: Germany accumulated seven points to finish top of Group A.
Denmark advanced to the last 16 by finishing second in Group C.
Germany should get the job done against Denmark as the knockouts begin.
Germany were one of the strongest performers in the group stage, with only Spain amassing more points.
Germany turned on the style on opening night, thrashing Scotland 5-1.
Germany eased to a 2-0 victory over Hungary in their second outing of the tournament.
Germany secured top spot in Group A with a 1-1 draw with Switzerland.
Nagelsmann’s side did stumble a little against the Swiss, needing a Niclas Fullrkug equalizer in second-half stoppage time to avoid defeat.
Denmark held England to a 1-1 draw in Group C of Euro 2024.
Denmark had stalemates against Slovenia (1-1) and Serbia (0-0).
Denmark are unbeaten at this European Championship but yet to win a game.
Denmark lined up in a 3-4-1-2 formation against Slovenia, before shifting to more of a 3-4-2-1 in their meetings with England and Serbia.
Germany are well balanced from back to front.
Toni Kroos will retire at the end of the Euros.
Kai Havertz is preferred by the manager in part because his clever movement opens up space for the impressive trio of Jamal Musiala, Florian Wirtz, and Ilkay Gundogan in attacking midfield.
Jonathan Tah will miss this match through suspension.
Miscellaneous Highlights: The match will be held at Signal Iduna Park, Dortmund, Germany.
The match is scheduled for Saturday, 29 June 2024 at 3:00 PM ET.
The match will be broadcast on FOX.
